alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Johnson; Linn; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 12:17AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cedar, northern Johnson, northwestern Muscatine and southeastern Linn Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1217 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Shueyville, or 11 miles south of Cedar Rapids, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cedar Rapids, Iowa City, West Branch, Coralville, North Liberty, Solon, Ely, Swisher, Shueyville, Lake Macbride State Park, Buchanan, Newport, Cedar Valley, Sugar Bottom Camp Ground, Sutliff, West Overlook, Coralville Lake Dam Complex, Springdale, Cou Falls and Cedar Bluff. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 244 and 259. Interstate 380 between mile markers 3 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
